title: Science Education Design Based on Bloom’s Cognitive Taxonomy: Case Studies and Qualitative Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced specialized knowledge in scientific fields and basic grasp of Bloom’s cognitive taxonomy
context.additional_context: Office/administrative professionals learn to systematically design science curricula according to Bloom’s cognitive levels. Utilizes asynchronous learning environments with personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can apply Bloom’s six cognitive taxonomy levels (remembering, understanding, applying, analyzing, evaluating, creating) to science education design
Through case studies, learners can explain how to assess cognitive level balance when designing instruction using AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT)
Learners can evaluate the distribution of cognitive levels in peers' instructional design artifacts using qualitative analysis techniques.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
